subSubSection.paragraph: Description:— Herb, climbing and trailing by means of tendrils; monoecious. Stem herbaceous, climbing, angular, pubescent, 0.2–0.3 cm diam.; tendrils 2-fid, spirally coiled just above branching point. Leaves simple, alternately arranged, petiolate, exstipulate, scabrid, palmately lobed, deep green, apex acute, dentate, 4–15 × 5–15 cm ; petiole cylindrical, 3–5 cm long, herbaceous, pubescent. Inflorescence axillary. Male flowers calyx tubular; corolla white, with 5 free petals, slightly hairy. Fruit round, cylindrical, sometimes irregular in shape, 5–15 cm diam., pedunculate, smooth, green.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5.
Cucumis sativus
. A. Fruiting plant in habitat. B. Morphological features showing (A) Flower section. (B) Tendrils. (C) Leaf. (D) Fruit. (E) Seed.

FIGURE 6.
Cucurbita maxima
. A. Plant in habitat with wilted flower and young fruit. B. Morphological features showing (A) Leaf. (B) Flower. (C) Tendrils. (D) Fruit. (E) Seed.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Location in
Akwa Ibom :—
Essien Udim, Oruk Anam, Obot Akara, Ikot Ekpene, Ibiono, Ibesikpo Asutan, Mkpat Enin, and Eastern Obolo
.
Abundance:— It existed in 47% of the sampling areas and was rare in these areas.
